security: Disclosing Identity A and Identity B's willingness to serve ODYOKE, a sensitive operation, without remuneration could jeopardize their safety and compromise ongoing intelligence activities. Revealing that Identity B 'has also been in contact with another ODYOKE component since January 62 and therefore cannot be approached by KUBARK' exposes operational coordination issues and could lead to conflicts or compromises within the intelligence network.
summary: A dispatch from the Chief of the Far East Division to the Acting Chief of Station in Djakarta regarding the upcoming visit of Identities A and B, with Identity A expressing willingness to serve ODYOKE and both having existing connections to ODYOKE components.
summary_one_paragraph: This dispatch, dated July 23, 1962, from the Chief of the Far East Division to the Acting Chief of Station in Djakarta, discusses the impending visit of Identity A (Irving Davidson) and Identity B (Paul Pesik). Identity A, associated with General Jani and involved in procurement activities, has offered to assist ODYOKE without payment, while Identity B has been in contact with another ODYOKE component since January 1962, precluding KUBARKâ€™s approach. The memo also notes Identity A's dealings with the local attache regarding aeronautical spare parts and potential export permit facilitation through his organization.
title: Visit of Identities
